sentences.english: He was a sort of almost irritating ubiquity; no halt was possible with him.
sentences.chinese: 他幾乎是一種激奮的化身，有了他，便不可能有停頓。

sentences.english: This topic generates a lot of heat.
sentences.chinese: 這個話題會引起羣情激奮。

sentences.english: No matter who they support, it is clear Pennsylvania voters are energized.
sentences.chinese: 不管支持哪位候選人，賓州的選民顯然都被激奮了。

sentences.english: I didn't realize the intensity of people's feelings on this issue.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有意識到這一問題能引起羣情激奮。

sentences.english: A good speaker can whip the crowd into a fever of excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她的講演者可以使聽衆羣情激奮。

sentences.english: What he said worked the crowd up to a fever of excitement.
sentences.chinese: 他的話使聽衆羣情激奮。

sentences.english: The speaker soon whipped the crowd into a fever of excitement.
sentences.chinese: 演講者很快便使聽衆羣情激奮。

sentences.english: After the bank debacle, a torch-and-pitchfork mob has been looking for vengeance.
sentences.chinese: 在銀行業崩潰之後，羣情激奮的民衆一直都很想泄憤。

sentences.english: But the political rhetoric just incites more animosity and gets people riled up.
sentences.chinese: 但政治的花言巧語只會激起更多的憤怒，讓羣情激奮。

sentences.english: As for the populace, it was seething yesterday, to-day it is not stirring.
sentences.chinese: 至於人民，昨天還很激奮，可是今晨卻沒有動靜了。
